intro: Dipteranthus densiflorus, commonly known as the dense-flowered dipteranthus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it thrives in moist, shady environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
